baseVersion.name: baseVersion
baseVersion.description: Software Version. The software version currently running. Defined as YMMR (i.e. Year, Month, Revision

baseRestartTime.name: baseRestartTime
baseRestartTime.description: BASE Restart Time. The time and data of the last system restart (i.e. power-on or last BOOT)

baseMaxPacketSize.name: baseMaxPacketSize
baseMaxPacketSize.description: Node Maximum Packet Size. The maximum single buffer size available on the MegaPAC.

baseBuffPoolMax.name: baseBuffPoolMax
baseBuffPoolMax.description: Node Buffer Pool Maximum. The maximum number of buffers available temporary storage of transitting data.

baseBuffPoolNow.name: baseBuffPoolNow
baseBuffPoolNow.description: Node Current Buffer Pool. The current number of free buffers available temporary storage of transitting data.

baseBufferPoolLowest.name: baseBufferPoolLowest
baseBufferPoolLowest.description: Node Buffer Pool Lowest. The lowest value the buffer pool has ever reached.

baseBufferPoolEmpty.name: baseBufferPoolEmpty
baseBufferPoolEmpty.description: Node Buffer Pool Empty. The number of times that the free buffer pool has fallen below the minimum buffer threshold 'baseBuffThreshold'.

baseStatBufferThreshold.name: baseStatBufferThreshold
baseStatBufferThreshold.description: Node Buffer Threshold. When the number of buffers in the free buffer pool reaches this threshold, flow control will occur.

baseMemorySize.name: baseMemorySize
baseMemorySize.description: Node Memory Size. The size of the system memory installed in the MegaPAC.

baseDataFramesIn.name: baseDataFramesIn
baseDataFramesIn.description: Node Frames In. The total number of frames received by the MegaPAC.

baseDataFramesOut.name: baseDataFramesOut
baseDataFramesOut.description: Node Frames Out. The total number of frames transmitted by the MegaPAC.

baseDataFrameRateIn.name: baseDataFrameRateIn
baseDataFrameRateIn.description: Node Frame Rate In. The rate measured in frames per second that the MegaPAC is currently receiving frames.

baseDataFrameRateOut.name: baseDataFrameRateOut
baseDataFrameRateOut.description: Node Frames Rate Out. The rate measured in frames per second that the MegaPAC is currently transmitting frames.

baseTotalCallSetUps.name: baseTotalCallSetUps
baseTotalCallSetUps.description: Node Total Call Set ups. The total number of calls successfully established by the MegaPAC.

baseCurrentCalls.name: baseCurrentCalls
baseCurrentCalls.description: Current calls. The number of calls currently active on the MegaPAC.

baseRetransmissions.name: baseRetransmissions
baseRetransmissions.description: Node Retransmissions. The total number of frames which have been retransmitted by the MegaPAC.

baseRejects.name: baseRejects
baseRejects.description: Node Rejects. The total number of frames that have been rejected by the MegaPAC.

baseTotalTransportCalls.name: baseTotalTransportCalls
baseTotalTransportCalls.description: Node Total Transport calls. The total number of transport calls established by the MegaPAC.

baseCurrentTransportCalls.name: baseCurrentTransportCalls
baseCurrentTransportCalls.description: Current Transport Calls. The number of transport calls currently active on the MegaPAC.

baseRunStatus.name: baseRunStatus
baseRunStatus.description: Node Run Status. This parameter indicates whether the operating system has been 'Booted' from RAM (TELELOAD) or EPROM (default).

baseReports.name: baseReports
baseReports.description: Node Reporting channel. The name of the logical resource (channel) that the system reports will be directed to.

baseSessionStatistics.name: baseSessionStatistics
baseSessionStatistics.description: Node Session Statistics reporting channel. The name of the logical resource (channel) that the system session statistics will be directed to.

baseBufferThreshold.name: baseBufferThreshold
baseBufferThreshold.description: Node Buffer Threshold. The threshold before flow control is invoked

baseInitialPresentationTimer.name: baseInitialPresentationTimer
baseInitialPresentationTimer.description: Node Initial Presentation Timer. The maximum time allowed between initial connection to the presentation service and the user entering a valid resource. The call will be disconnected if this timer elapses.

baseSecondaryPresentationTimer.name: baseSecondaryPresentationTimer
baseSecondaryPresentationTimer.description: Node Secondary Presentation Timer. After a call has been cleared by the Host DTE the user has the option to use the presentation service to establish another call, failure to do so within this time period will result in the initial call being cleared.

baseInactivityDetectTimer.name: baseInactivityDetectTimer
baseInactivityDetectTimer.description: Node Inactivity Timer. This timer will cause calls to be cleared if the IDLE option has been configured on the channel.

baseSegmentAccounting.name: baseSegmentAccounting
baseSegmentAccounting.description: Node Segment Accounting. This parameter causes the frames in/out parameters to be displayed in terms of 64 byte SEGMENTS rather than frames.

baseTerminalEmulationBuffers.name: baseTerminalEmulationBuffers
baseTerminalEmulationBuffers.description: Terminal Emulation Buffers. The number of system buffers allocated for Terminal Emulation purposes.

baseTransportBuffers.name: baseTransportBuffers
baseTransportBuffers.description: Transport Buffers. The number of transport buffers allocated for TP 0,2,3,4 sessions.

baseCountrySettings.name: baseCountrySettings
baseCountrySettings.description: Country Setting. Invokes the ASCII representation of the Japanese character set.

baseTeleloadEnabled.name: baseTeleloadEnabled
baseTeleloadEnabled.description: Teleload enable. If set to yes the MegaPAC software may be downloaded by ASCII file transfer.

baseDefaultToPromCompatible.name: baseDefaultToPromCompatible
baseDefaultToPromCompatible.description: Cold Boot From PROM. If set to yes the MegaPAC software may be downloaded by ASCII file transfer.

baseCommand.name: baseCommand
baseCommand.description: Allows SNMP manager to execute commands.

baseCommandControllerIndex.name: baseCommandControllerIndex
baseCommandControllerIndex.description: Sets controller index for baseCommands where relevant.

baseCommandChannelndex.name: baseCommandChannelndex
baseCommandChannelndex.description: Sets channel index for baseCommands where relevant.

baseConnectedToProtocol.name: baseConnectedToProtocol
baseConnectedToProtocol.description: Indicates the VCP state. NULL is VCP free; a returned value indicates BUSY and maps the access protocol.

baseBillingThreshold.name: baseBillingThreshold
baseBillingThreshold.description: Sets threshold for billing alarms - entry written to ELOG file, and trap sent.

baseBillUnread.name: baseBillUnread
baseBillUnread.description: Number of BILLING records outstanding - to be read by SNMP manager.

baseCurrentBill.name: baseCurrentBill
baseCurrentBill.description: Record number of current available BILLING record.

baseCurrentConfig.name: baseCurrentConfig
baseCurrentConfig.description: A decimal number from 0000 to 9999 representing the current configuration.

baseCommandBuffer.name: baseCommandBuffer
baseCommandBuffer.description: The VCP single line command string buffer.

baseCommandLength.name: baseCommandLength
baseCommandLength.description: The length in Hex of the single line command string.

baseEMPresent.name: baseEMPresent
baseEMPresent.description: Indicator of whether Environmental Monitor is present.

baseEMTempTens.name: baseEMTempTens
baseEMTempTens.description: Tens part of Environmental Monitor temperature.

baseEMTempUnits.name: baseEMTempUnits
baseEMTempUnits.description: Unit part of Environmental Monitor temperature.

baseCPUUtil.name: baseCPUUtil
baseCPUUtil.description: CPU utilisation in the range 0 to 100.

ctrlNumberConfigured.name: ctrlNumberConfigured
ctrlNumberConfigured.description: Total Number of Controllers Configured. The number of controllers in the MegaPAC which have been configured.

ctrlTotalNumber.name: ctrlTotalNumber
ctrlTotalNumber.description: Total Number of Controllers. The TOTAL number of controllers in the MegaPAC including unconfigured (NULL) controllers.

ctrlStatIndex.name: ctrlStatIndex
ctrlStatIndex.description: Controller index. The position of this controller in relation to 'BASE'. i.e. BASE = 0 NMSC = 1 PS01 = 2 ...

ctrlStatName.name: ctrlStatName
ctrlStatName.description: Controller name. The unique 4 character name by which this controller is known.

ctrlStatType.name: ctrlStatType
ctrlStatType.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatType.description: Controller Type. The type of software controller.

ctrlStatSubType.name: ctrlStatSubType
ctrlStatSubType.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM SDLC QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatSubType.description: Sub Type. The serial I/O board installed.

ctrlStatNumberChannels.name: ctrlStatNumberChannels
ctrlStatNumberChannels.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatNumberChannels.description: Channel Count. The number of channels assigned to a controller.

ctrlStatFirstChannelIndex.name: ctrlStatFirstChannelIndex
ctrlStatFirstChannelIndex.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatFirstChannelIndex.description: First Channnel. The 1st channel index number used by the controller : PPP, X.25, XFRM, NFRM VFRM, CONS, IP, TIP, IPX, TIPX, ESIS, DLC, LAN, TLAN, ILAN, XLAN SDLC, TERM, QLLC & HDLC

ctrlStatCRCErrors.name: ctrlStatCRCErrors
ctrlStatCRCErrors.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatCRCErrors.description: CRC Errors. The number of packets received for which the checksum was not valid.

ctrlStatTotalCallSetUps.name: ctrlStatTotalCallSetUps
ctrlStatTotalCallSetUps.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatTotalCallSetUps.description: Total Call Set ups. The total number of successful calls established on this link.

ctrlStatCurrentCalls.name: ctrlStatCurrentCalls
ctrlStatCurrentCalls.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatCurrentCalls.description: Current Calls. The number of calls currently active on this link.

ctrlStatDataIn.name: ctrlStatDataIn
ctrlStatDataIn.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC

ctrlStatDataOut.name: ctrlStatDataOut
ctrlStatDataOut.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatDataOut.description: Data Out. The total number of data bytes transmitted on this link.

ctrlStatDataFramesIn.name: ctrlStatDataFramesIn
ctrlStatDataFramesIn.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatDataFramesIn.description: Data Frames In. The total number of data frames received on this link.

ctrlStatDataFramesOut.name: ctrlStatDataFramesOut
ctrlStatDataFramesOut.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatDataFramesOut.description: Data Frames Out. The total number of data frames transmitted on this link.

ctrlStatDataFrameRateIn.name: ctrlStatDataFrameRateIn
ctrlStatDataFrameRateIn.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatDataFrameRateIn.description: Data Frame Rate In. The rate that frames are arriving on this link, specified in frames per second.

ctrlStatDataFrameRateOut.name: ctrlStatDataFrameRateOut
ctrlStatDataFrameRateOut.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatDataFrameRateOut.description: Data Frame Frate Out. The rate that frames are being transmitted on this link, specified in frames per second.

ctrlStatCallsReceived.name: ctrlStatCallsReceived
ctrlStatCallsReceived.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC IPX TIPX ESIS LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN
ctrlStatCallsReceived.description: Calls Received. The total number of incoming call requests seen on this link.

ctrlStatCallsSent.name: ctrlStatCallsSent
ctrlStatCallsSent.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC IPX TIPX ESIS LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN
ctrlStatCallsSent.description: Calls Sent. The total number of call requests sent out on this link.

ctrlStatClearsReceived.name: ctrlStatClearsReceived
ctrlStatClearsReceived.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC IPX TIPX ESIS LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN
ctrlStatClearsReceived.description: Clears Received. The total number of call clear requests received on this link.

ctrlStatRetransmissions.name: ctrlStatRetransmissions
ctrlStatRetransmissions.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatRetransmissions.description: Retransmissions. The number of packets that have been transmitted more than once on this link.

ctrlStatRejects.name: ctrlStatRejects
ctrlStatRejects.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatRejects.description: Rejects. The total number of packets which have been rejected on this link.

ctrlStatState.name: ctrlStatState
ctrlStatState.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatState.description: State. The level 2 data state of the link.

ctrlStatSubState.name: ctrlStatSubState
ctrlStatSubState.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatSubState.description: Sub State. The level 3 state of this link.

ctrlStatNoTries.name: ctrlStatNoTries
ctrlStatNoTries.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatNoTries.description: Tries. The number of un-numbered control frames sent to try and establish the link.

ctrlStatOptions.name: ctrlStatOptions
ctrlStatOptions.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatOptions.description: Options The options currently configured for this link. Note, that the values returned by the MegaPAC may be additive values - representing combined combinations for the table listed e.g. poll+ext.

ctrlStatLCGN.name: ctrlStatLCGN
ctrlStatLCGN.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatLCGN.description: LCGN The logical channel group number for this link.

ctrlStatResetsReceived.name: ctrlStatResetsReceived
ctrlStatResetsReceived.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatResetsReceived.description: Resets Received. The total number of reset packets received on this link.

ctrlStatInterruptsReceived.name: ctrlStatInterruptsReceived
ctrlStatInterruptsReceived.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatInterruptsReceived.description: Interupts Received. The total number of interrupt packets received on this link.

ctrlStatOuputQueueLength.name: ctrlStatOuputQueueLength
ctrlStatOuputQueueLength.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM CONS DLC SDLC TERM QLLC HDLC
ctrlStatOuputQueueLength.description: Output Queue Length. The number of packets queued for transmission on this link.

ctrlStatStationAddress.name: ctrlStatStationAddress
ctrlStatStationAddress.reference: CONS IPX TIPX ESIS LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN IP TIP
ctrlStatStationAddress.description: Local MAC Address The MAC Address of the MegaPAC.

ctrlStatDestinationAddress.name: ctrlStatDestinationAddress
ctrlStatDestinationAddress.description: Destination MAC Address. The MAC Address of the destination device.

ctrlStatEIA.name: ctrlStatEIA
ctrlStatEIA.description: EIA state. Displays the EIA signals currently on the link.

ctrlStatSdlcOptions.name: ctrlStatSdlcOptions
ctrlStatSdlcOptions.description: SDLC Options. A range of link level options used for establishing IBM connections.

ctrlStatArpRequestRec.name: ctrlStatArpRequestRec
ctrlStatArpRequestRec.description: ARP Requests Received. The number of ARP requests sent to the MegaPAC

ctrlStatArpRequestSent.name: ctrlStatArpRequestSent
ctrlStatArpRequestSent.description: ARP Requests Sent. The number of ARP requests processed to the local LAN by the MegaPAC

ctrlStatArpResponsesRec.name: ctrlStatArpResponsesRec
ctrlStatArpResponsesRec.description: ARP Respones Received. The number of ARP responses returned to the the MegaPAC

ctrlStatTestType.name: ctrlStatTestType
ctrlStatTestType.description: Allows SNMP manager to set V54 tests; local or remote or off.

ctrlStatTestSet.name: ctrlStatTestSet
ctrlStatTestSet.description: Allows SNMP manager to apply the local/remote V54 test selection.

ctrlStatTest.name: ctrlStatTest
ctrlStatTest.description: Allows SNMP manager to activate local/remote V54 test.

ctrlStatLstate.name: ctrlStatLstate
ctrlStatLstate.description: Allows SNMP manager to read Local Loop test result.

ctrlStatRstate.name: ctrlStatRstate
ctrlStatRstate.description: Allows SNMP manager to read Remote Loop test result.

ctrlParamIndex.name: ctrlParamIndex
ctrlParamIndex.description: Index The position of this controller in relation to 'BASE'. i.e. BASE = 0 NMSC = 1 PS01 = 2 ...

ctrlParamName.name: ctrlParamName
ctrlParamName.description: Name. The unique 4 character name by which this controller is known.

ctrlParamSubType.name: ctrlParamSubType
ctrlParamSubType.reference: NFRM VFRM PPP QLLC SDLC X25 NULL XFRM
ctrlParamSubType.description: Sub-Type. The link between the controller and its associated hardware type.

ctrlParamNoChannels.name: ctrlParamNoChannels
ctrlParamNoChannels.description: Number of channels. The number of logical channels configured on the controller.

ctrlParamSpeed.name: ctrlParamSpeed
ctrlParamSpeed.reference: NFRM VFRM PPP QLLC SDLC X25 NULL XFRM
ctrlParamSpeed.description: Speed. The clock speed of the interface.

ctrlParamInterfaceType.name: ctrlParamInterfaceType
ctrlParamInterfaceType.reference: NFRM VFRM PPP QLLC SDLC X25 NULL XFRM
ctrlParamInterfaceType.description: The serial interface type. Note, Only applicable to MegaCard.

ctrlParamPacketSize.name: ctrlParamPacketSize
ctrlParamPacketSize.reference: CONS DLC TERM X25 NULL HDLC
ctrlParamPacketSize.description: Packet Size. The maximum packet size in bytes of outgoing packets, this parameter must be less than or equal to the 'BASE' statistic 'maxPacketSize'.

ctrlParamV54Modem.name: ctrlParamV54Modem
ctrlParamV54Modem.description: V54 Modem. Enable V54 loop back testing. Note this does not initiate loop back testing, the loop back is initiated by typing in the 'TEST' command.

ctrlParamAddress.name: ctrlParamAddress
ctrlParamAddress.description: Address. The logical address designation of the controller.

ctrlParamOptions.name: ctrlParamOptions
ctrlParamOptions.reference: CONS DLC ILAN QLLC SDLC X25 NULL XLAN
ctrlParamOptions.description: Options. A range of controller options, options may be specified individually or added together.

ctrlParamInitFrame.name: ctrlParamInitFrame
ctrlParamInitFrame.reference: CONS DLC ILAN X25 NULL XLAN

ctrlParamT1.name: ctrlParamT1
ctrlParamT1.reference: CONS DLC ILAN X25 NULL XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamT1.description: T1. Timer for retransmission of unacknowleged frames. Specified in 0.1 second units.

ctrlParamTries.name: ctrlParamTries
ctrlParamTries.reference: CONS DLC ILAN QLLC SDLC X25 NULL XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamTries.description: Tries. The number of times a frame will be retransmitted before a link restart is initiated.

ctrlParamKLevel2.name: ctrlParamKLevel2
ctrlParamKLevel2.reference: CONS X25 NULL XLAN ILAN DLC HDLC

ctrlParamKLevel3.name: ctrlParamKLevel3
ctrlParamKLevel3.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC DLC ILAN

ctrlParamLineGroup.name: ctrlParamLineGroup
ctrlParamLineGroup.reference: CONS ILAN X25 NULL XFRM XLAN
ctrlParamLineGroup.description: Line Group. The line group is used for load sharing. If two links have same (non-zero) line group then data may be shared between them.

ctrlParamLCGN.name: ctrlParamLCGN
ctrlParamLCGN.reference: CONS ILAN X25 NULL XFRM XLAN
ctrlParamLCGN.description: LCGN. The logical channel group number for this link.

ctrlParamLCNOffset.name: ctrlParamLCNOffset
ctrlParamLCNOffset.reference: CONS ILAN X25 NULL XFRM XLAN
ctrlParamLCNOffset.description: LCN Offset. This parameter is used in conjunction with the LCGN. It's purpose is to shift the channel range by the appropriate offset.

ctrlParamAddressGroup.name: ctrlParamAddressGroup
ctrlParamAddressGroup.reference: CONS ILAN X25 NULL XFRM XLAN
ctrlParamAddressGroup.description: Address Group. This parameter is used in conjunction with the address group field in the x25 file to provide different addressing domains.

ctrlParamFrameSequence.name: ctrlParamFrameSequence
ctrlParamFrameSequence.reference: CONS ILAN QLLC SDLC X25 NULL XFRM XLAN
ctrlParamFrameSequence.description: Frame Sequence. This parameter determines if normal or extended frame sequencing is supported.

ctrlParamCallTimeOut.name: ctrlParamCallTimeOut
ctrlParamCallTimeOut.reference: CONS ILAN QLLC SDLC TERM X25 NULL XFRM XLAN
ctrlParamCallTimeOut.description: Call Time Out. The time in seconds the MegaPAC will wait to receive a call accept packet before clearing the call.

ctrlParamErrorThreshold.name: ctrlParamErrorThreshold
ctrlParamErrorThreshold.reference: CONS ILAN X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamErrorThreshold.description: Error Threshold. The number of CRC errors that will be accepted before generating an error report.

ctrlParamLoopBarPriority.name: ctrlParamLoopBarPriority
ctrlParamLoopBarPriority.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamLoopBarPriority.description: Loop Bar Priority. Prevents calls from looping on the same controller.

ctrlParamExtendedCallMgmt.name: ctrlParamExtendedCallMgmt
ctrlParamExtendedCallMgmt.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamExtendedCallMgmt.description: Extended Call Management. Invokes extended packet processing facilities via the MAC file.

ctrlParamOptionalTimers.name: ctrlParamOptionalTimers
ctrlParamOptionalTimers.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamOptionalTimers.description: Optional Timers. Optional level 3 timers for clearing calls when a clear confirmation has not been received after a clear request has been sent. T13 is used if the controller is set to be a logical DCE and the timeout will be 60 seconds. T23 is used if the controller is a logical DTE and the timeout is 180 seconds.

ctrlParamOptionalFlags.name: ctrlParamOptionalFlags
ctrlParamOptionalFlags.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamOptionalFlags.description: Optional Flags. This parameter is used to insert extra flags between frames to slow down the rate of transmission. It will only take effect on controllers with a sub-type of XIO.

ctrlParamTransportLevelType.name: ctrlParamTransportLevelType
ctrlParamTransportLevelType.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamTransportLevelType.description: Transport Level Type. Enable the ISO transport facility.

ctrlParamTransportClass.name: ctrlParamTransportClass
ctrlParamTransportClass.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamTransportClass.description: Transport Class. The type of transport class implemented.

ctrlParamDefaultWindowSize.name: ctrlParamDefaultWindowSize
ctrlParamDefaultWindowSize.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamDefaultWindowSize.description: Default Window Size. The initial credit limit to be used on a transport session.

ctrlParamDisableFlowControl.name: ctrlParamDisableFlowControl
ctrlParamDisableFlowControl.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamDisableFlowControl.description: Disable Flow Control. Enable/disable flow control on a tranport class 2 call.

ctrlParamTSAPFormat.name: ctrlParamTSAPFormat
ctrlParamTSAPFormat.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamTSAPFormat.description: TSAP Format. Determines how the TSAP's will be treated internally by the MegaPAC. If set to text the local and remote TSAP's will be converted to form a 4 character internal resource name. If set to hex the first two hexadecimal pairs will form the resource name.

ctrlParamMaximumTPDUSize.name: ctrlParamMaximumTPDUSize
ctrlParamMaximumTPDUSize.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC ILAN
ctrlParamMaximumTPDUSize.description: Max. TPDU Size. The maximum Transport Protocol Data Unit Size.

ctrlParamTTRTime.name: ctrlParamTTRTime
ctrlParamTTRTime.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamTTRTime.description: TTR Timer. Time To Resynchronise. Specifies the time delay in seconds for the transport class three timer to resync at the initiating end.

ctrlParamTWRTime.name: ctrlParamTWRTime
ctrlParamTWRTime.reference: CONS X25 NULL XFRM XLAN HDLC
ctrlParamTWRTime.description: TWR Timer. Time to Wait for Resynchronisation. The time delay in seconds allowed for the transport class 3 timer at the responding end to wait for resynchronisation, before clearing down the transport session.

ctrlParamDestinationAddress.name: ctrlParamDestinationAddress
ctrlParamDestinationAddress.description: Destination Address. The physical address of the target device.

ctrlParamDSAP.name: ctrlParamDSAP
ctrlParamDSAP.description: DSAP. The Destination Service Access Point.

ctrlParamSSAP.name: ctrlParamSSAP
ctrlParamSSAP.description: SSAP. The Source Service Access Point.

ctrlParamSDLCOptions.name: ctrlParamSDLCOptions
ctrlParamSDLCOptions.description: SDLC Options. A range of link level options used for establishing IBM connections.

ctrlParamPrimaryStation.name: ctrlParamPrimaryStation
ctrlParamPrimaryStation.description: Primary Station. This parameter determines whether the MegaPAC will operate as a HOST primary connection (yes) or a CLUSTER secondary connection (no).

ctrlParamIdleDetectTime.name: ctrlParamIdleDetectTime
ctrlParamIdleDetectTime.description: Idle Detect Timer. This parameter determines the time period in tenths of a second before an unacknowleged POLL/RESPONSE frame will be retransmitted.

ctrlParamPollInterval.name: ctrlParamPollInterval
ctrlParamPollInterval.description: Poll Interval. The time period in tenths of a second between sending POLL frames.

ctrlParamDuplex.name: ctrlParamDuplex
ctrlParamDuplex.description: Duplex. Enables SDLC full duplex operation, half duplex operation is reserved for future use.

ctrlParamTransmitDelay.name: ctrlParamTransmitDelay
ctrlParamTransmitDelay.description: Transmit Delay. Determines the time period in tenths of a second between the MegaPAC receiving an RR frame with the P-Bit set and the MegaPAC issuing an RR response with the F-Bit set.

ctrlParamSlowPollTimer.name: ctrlParamSlowPollTimer
ctrlParamSlowPollTimer.description: Slow Poll Timer. When the controller has been defined as a primary station a slow poll rate can be specified for polling a Cluster controller that is down. This is to avoid causing delays to working Cluster controllers in a multi-point mode. The value is specified in tenths of a second.

ctrlParamMaxCallInterval.name: ctrlParamMaxCallInterval
ctrlParamMaxCallInterval.description: Max. Call Interval. When controller is configured as a primary station, a call request retry interval may be defined, so as to avoid the situation where successive call requests are continuously generated to the network. The initial call interval is 2 seconds, this interval is progressively doubled until the Maximum Call Interval (defined in minutes) is reached.

ctrlParamMaxCallCycles.name: ctrlParamMaxCallCycles
ctrlParamMaxCallCycles.description: Max. Call Cycles. This parameter is used in conjunction with the Maximum Call Interval parameter. It specifies the maximum number of call request cycles that can take effect before call requests continue at the Maximum Call Interval parameter setting. Each cycle consisting of call requests being initiated at intervals in incrementing multiples of two seconds, up to the Maximum Call Interval parameter.

ctrlParamGroupPoll.name: ctrlParamGroupPoll
ctrlParamGroupPoll.description: Group Poll. Used in SNA applications, where the specified value would generate multiple down-stream poll requests.

ctrlParamDelayToRTSLow.name: ctrlParamDelayToRTSLow
ctrlParamDelayToRTSLow.description: Delay RTS Low. Specifies the number of padding characters to be inserted between the end of data transmission and the dropping of the RTS signal. Only required for synchronous operation.

ctrlParamDelayToCTSHigh.name: ctrlParamDelayToCTSHigh
ctrlParamDelayToCTSHigh.description: Delay CTS High. Specifies the number of padding characters to be inserted between the dropping of RTS and the raising of CTS. Only required for synchronous operation.

ctrlParamInputSyncDeletion.name: ctrlParamInputSyncDeletion
ctrlParamInputSyncDeletion.description: Input Sync Deletion. If set, all SYNC characters will be stripped prior to transmission. Only effective in synchronous full duplex mode.

ctrlParamOutputSyncInsertion.name: ctrlParamOutputSyncInsertion
ctrlParamOutputSyncInsertion.description: Output Sync Insertion. Specifies the number of SYNC characters to be transmitted prior to the start of the data block. Only effective in synchronous operation.

ctrlParamDCDFilter.name: ctrlParamDCDFilter
ctrlParamDCDFilter.description: DCD Filter. A filter delay specified in tenths of a second which prevents unwanted link restarts caused by toggling of DCD signal.

ctrlParamInhibitTimeFill.name: ctrlParamInhibitTimeFill
ctrlParamInhibitTimeFill.description: Inhibit Time Fill Allows the insertion of time fill frames to compensate for network delays. Effective in synchronous mode only.

ctrlParamDefaultLocalPrinter.name: ctrlParamDefaultLocalPrinter
ctrlParamDefaultLocalPrinter.description: Default Local Printer. The number of the channel which is reserved for a Screen Print server, a value of (0) disables the Screen Print facility.

ctrlParamNewLANInterface.name: ctrlParamNewLANInterface
ctrlParamNewLANInterface.reference: IP TIP IPX TIPX ESIS DLC LAN TLAN ILAN XLAN
ctrlParamNewLANInterface.description: New FRM Port. This controller marks the first position of a controller connection to a LAN interface. All other controllers defined as NewPhysicalInterface/ No will map to the same interface defined as NewPhysicalInterface/ Yes.

ctrlParamNewSerialInterface.name: ctrlParamNewSerialInterface
ctrlParamNewSerialInterface.reference: PPP X25 XFRM NFRM VFRM SDLC QLLC HDLC
ctrlParamNewSerialInterface.description: New FRM Port. This controller marks the first position of a controller connection to a serial interface. All other controllers defined as NewPhysicalInterface/ No will map to the same interface defined as NewPhysicalInterface/ Yes.

ctrlParamMode.name: ctrlParamMode
ctrlParamMode.description: Defines a Network to Network Inteface (NNI) or User Network Interface (UNI) implementation. Where MegaPAC connects to a Frame Realy switch, this parameter just be defined as DTE i.e. a UNI, otherwise when connecting operating as a switch, NNI i.e. DCE operation must be specified. All controllers mapped to the same physical interface must be configured the same mode setting

ctrlParamLmi.name: ctrlParamLmi
ctrlParamLmi.description: Local Management Inteface (LMI). Ansi = ANSI LMI yes = T1.S1 LMI no = LMI disabled.

ctrlParamKeepAliveTimer.name: ctrlParamKeepAliveTimer
ctrlParamKeepAliveTimer.description: Only applicable if the LMI is active. Specifies in seconds the interval between keep alive messages. If this end is a DTE, this is the actual interval between Status Requests generated to the DCE. If this end is a DCE, then the timer is used simply to detect whether connection to the DTE has been lost. Note: it is the DTE which is the active partner across the LMI interface, in accordance with the LMI specification.

ctrlParamStatusEnquiryInterval.name: ctrlParamStatusEnquiryInterval
ctrlParamStatusEnquiryInterval.description: Frame Relay : Specifies how often a DTE sends a or a DCE expects a Full Status Request message. The number specified is the ratio between Status Requets messages, and Full Status Request enquiries. For example, if the value 10 is specified, and this end is a DTE, then every 10th status request would include a full status request (in the above example every 100 seconds).

ctrlParamBandwidth.name: ctrlParamBandwidth
ctrlParamBandwidth.description: The sample period used in enforcing the committed information rate (CIR). The CIR expressed in terms of characters per 1/10 th second. There are two further parameters which appear directly after the BANDWIDTH/ prompt which are designed to handle bursty traffic (i.e. Bc and Be).

ctrlParamBurstCommit.name: ctrlParamBurstCommit
ctrlParamBurstCommit.description: Burst Commit, i.e. the number of characters the remote end is committed to buffering, in our case in a 1/10th of a second period

ctrlParamBurstEligibility.name: ctrlParamBurstEligibility
ctrlParamBurstEligibility.description: Burst Eligibility, i.e the DLCI in question is enabled to transmit a burst beyond its committed information rate, when enabled to do so by the state of the other DLCIs. The figure given is again with respect to a 1/10th second period, and the maximum data rate when the DLCI is enabled to transmit at its burst rate is given by the equation ; Maximum data rate = CIR(1+Be/Bc) It should be noted that on DLCIs which are carrying data of a non-bursty nature (e.g voice traffic), the Be should be configured as zero (thereby telling the MegaPAC that it is carrying traffic of a non-bursty nature.) Secondly, if the Bc value is configured as zero, the MegaPAC uses a default sample period of 1 second.

chanNumberConfigured.name: chanNumberConfigured
chanNumberConfigured.description: Number of channels. The number of channels configured.

chanStatTable.name: chanStatTable
chanStatTable.description: A table of channels associated with a controller.

chanStatIndex.name: chanStatIndex
chanStatIndex.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatIndex.description: Index. The position of this channel in the controller channel Table.

chanStatName.name: chanStatName
chanStatName.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatName.description: Name. A user defined name for routing calls to this channel.

chanStatControllerIndex.name: chanStatControllerIndex
chanStatControllerIndex.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatControllerIndex.description: Controller Index. The index to the controller that this channel operates within.

chanStatNameCtrlName.name: chanStatNameCtrlName
chanStatNameCtrlName.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatNameCtrlName.description: Controller Name. The controller NAME supporting this channel

chanStatConnectedToChannelIndex.name: chanStatConnectedToChannelIndex
chanStatConnectedToChannelIndex.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatConnectedToChannelIndex.description: Connected to Index. The INDEX of the CHANNEL that this channel is connected to.

chanStatState.name: chanStatState
chanStatState.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatState.description: State. The current Status of the channel, the status may be one or a combination of the following: disc Disconnected. emul Channel in Terminal Emulation mode. emul Channel in Terminal Emulation mode. post Processing data before forwarding e.g. LF insert in async. busy Temporarily unavailable. call Outgoing channel making call. data Data transfer, call in progress. wake Outgoing channel transmitting. setup Incoming channel waiting outgoing channel call setup. rout Incoming channel waiting assignment of outgoing channel. addr Incoming channel waiting resource selection. name Incoming channel is processing a users password. look Incoming channel is looking-up a users password name. serv Service selection mode awaiting resource code NAME. pass Incoming channel is processing a users password. rung Ring Indicator MUX PORT only.

chanStatSessionStatus.name: chanStatSessionStatus
chanStatSessionStatus.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatSessionStatus.description: Session Status. The Status of the channel during a call session, the status may be one or a combination of the following: State Description CALL Call Originator. DRI Flow controlling input. DRO Flow controlling on output. TRAN Presentation service not involved in call set-up. QUEU Queued to selected resource. STAT Awaiting queue status information. PAD In PAD Recall mode. DISC Data buffers draining before clearing call.

chanStatEIA.name: chanStatEIA
chanStatEIA.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP ROUT DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP SNMP
chanStatEIA.description: EIA Displays the status of the V24/V28 signals on term or muxport links, or call status on X.25 links. The down state indicates that level 2 is inactive.

chanStatTotalFramesIn.name: chanStatTotalFramesIn
chanStatTotalFramesIn.reference: CONS IP SDLC LAN ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 ROUT DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP
chanStatTotalFramesIn.description: Total Frames In. The total number of frames received on this channel since it entered Data State.

chanStatTotalFramesOut.name: chanStatTotalFramesOut
chanStatTotalFramesOut.reference: CONS IP SDLC LAN ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 ROUT DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP
chanStatTotalFramesOut.description: Total Frames out. The total number of frames transmitted on this channel since it entered Data State.

chanStatTotalCharsIn.name: chanStatTotalCharsIn
chanStatTotalCharsIn.reference: CONS IP SDLC LAN ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 ROUT DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP
chanStatTotalCharsIn.description: Total Characters In. The total number of characters received on this channel since it entered Data State.

chanStatTotalCharsOut.name: chanStatTotalCharsOut
chanStatTotalCharsOut.reference: CONS IP SDLC LAN ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 ROUT DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP
chanStatTotalCharsOut.description: Total Characters Out. The total number of characters transmitted on this channel since it entered Data State.

chanStatTxWindow.name: chanStatTxWindow
chanStatTxWindow.reference: CONS ILAN XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatTxWindow.description: Tx Window. The Level 3 Transmit Window size.

chanStatRxWindow.name: chanStatRxWindow
chanStatRxWindow.reference: CONS ILAN XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatRxWindow.description: Rx Window. The Level 3 Receive Window size.

chanStatTxSize.name: chanStatTxSize
chanStatTxSize.reference: CONS ILAN XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatTxSize.description: Tx Size. The maximum size for outgoing packets.

chanStatRxSize.name: chanStatRxSize
chanStatRxSize.reference: CONS ILAN XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatRxSize.description: Rx Size. The maximum acceptable size for incoming packets.

chanStatCause.name: chanStatCause
chanStatCause.reference: CONS QLLC XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM SDLC DLC
chanStatCause.description: Cause. The value of the cause code in the last Clear Packet received or transmitted (decimal).

chanStatDiagnostic.name: chanStatDiagnostic
chanStatDiagnostic.reference: CONS QLLC XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM SDLC DLC
chanStatDiagnostic.description: Diagnostic. The value of the diagnostic code in the last Clear Packet received or transmitted (decimal).

chanStatResetCause.name: chanStatResetCause
chanStatResetCause.reference: CONS QLLC XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM SDLC DLC
chanStatResetCause.description: Reset Cause. The value of the last reset code in the last RESET packet transmitted.

chanStatResetDiagnostic.name: chanStatResetDiagnostic
chanStatResetDiagnostic.reference: CONS QLLC XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM SDLC DLC
chanStatResetDiagnostic.description: Reset Diagnostic. The value of the last diagnostic code in the last RESET packet transmitted.

chanStatResetCauseReceived.name: chanStatResetCauseReceived
chanStatResetCauseReceived.reference: CONS QLLC XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM SDLC DLC
chanStatResetCauseReceived.description: Reset Cause Received. The value of the last reset code in the last RESET packet received.

chanStatResetDiagReceived.name: chanStatResetDiagReceived
chanStatResetDiagReceived.reference: CONS QLLC XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM SDLC DLC
chanStatResetDiagReceived.description: Reset Diagnostic Received. The value of the last diagnostic code in the last RESET packet received.

chanStatLevel3State.name: chanStatLevel3State
chanStatLevel3State.reference: CONS XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatLevel3State.description: Level 3 State. The level 3 status of the channel.

chanStatCallPriority.name: chanStatCallPriority
chanStatCallPriority.reference: CONS XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatCallPriority.description: Call Priority. Call and Resource priorities are used primarily for providing alternate routing. For a call to succeed the Call Priority on the incoming channel must be greater than or equal to the Resource Priority on the outgoing channel.

chanStatResourcePriority.name: chanStatResourcePriority
chanStatResourcePriority.reference: CONS XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM

chanStatPadEnable.name: chanStatPadEnable
chanStatPadEnable.reference: CONS XLAN HDLC X25 NFRM VFRM XFRM
chanStatPadEnable.description: PAD Enable. The value of this statistic reflects the setting as configured on the channel.

chanStatPortMatch.name: chanStatPortMatch
chanStatPortMatch.reference: IP LAN TLAN ESIS IPX TIPX TIP
chanStatPortMatch.description: Port Match. The TCP port that is connected

chanStatPrimaryStation.name: chanStatPrimaryStation
chanStatPrimaryStation.description: Primary Station. Determines whether the MegaPAC port is functioning as a Primary or Secondary SDLC station.

chanStatSDLCState.name: chanStatSDLCState
chanStatSDLCState.description: SDLC State. The State of the SDLC connection, may be one of the following: State Description ACTIVE The SNRM and UA commands have been sent successfully. If primary, the P-Bit has not been sent (i.e. has not been polled). If secondary, the P-Bit has not been received (has got F-Bit and not been polled again). DISC Primary station only. Either a 'STOP' command has been issued for the port, or a QDISC command has been received from the network. The MegaPAC will be sending an SDLC DISC command with the P-Bit set. POLL If primary, the MegaPAC has sent a frame with the P-Bit (has polled). If secondary, the MegaPAC has received the P-Bit (has been polled). SNRM Only for primary stations. The MegaPAC has sent a SNRM, but has not received a UA.

chanStatQLLCState.name: chanStatQLLCState
chanStatQLLCState.description: QLLC State. The State of the QLLC connection, may be one of the following: State Description CLSD The MegaPAC has received a QDISC and sent a QUA on the network. This sets the DISC state on the SDLC port. CLSI The MegaPAC has sent a QDISC and is waiting for a QUA. FRMR The MegaPAC has received a QFRMR from the network. INOP The SVC is down. OPEN The VC is running. QSM and QUA have been sent and received. OPNI The MegaPAC has sent a QSM and is awaiting a QUA.

chanStatSDLCTransmitState.name: chanStatSDLCTransmitState
chanStatSDLCTransmitState.description: SDLC Transmit State. May be one of the following: State Description NORM The MegaPAC is allowed to transmit data. NULL The MegaPAC is not allowed to transmit data. RNR The MegaPAC has received an RNR. RTRY The MegaPAC is in the retransmission state.

chanStatPolls.name: chanStatPolls
chanStatPolls.description: Polls. The quantity of polls that have occured since the link was established

chanStatStationAddress.name: chanStatStationAddress
chanStatStationAddress.description: Station Address. The IBM PU poll address

chanStatXIDIdentification.name: chanStatXIDIdentification
chanStatXIDIdentification.description: XID Identification. This field contains the first 64 bytes of the XID that has been used.

chanStatTries.name: chanStatTries
chanStatTries.description: Tries. The number of times the current command has been transmitted.

chanStatLUActive.name: chanStatLUActive
chanStatLUActive.description: LU Active. If set to YES then the MegaPAC Logical Unit has responded positively to an ACTLU command. If set to NO the MegaPAC has either not received or has responded negatively to an ACTLU command.

chanStatBindActive.name: chanStatBindActive
chanStatBindActive.description: Bind Active. If set to YES then the MegaPAC Logical Unit has responded positively to a BIND command. If set to NO the MegaPAC has either not received or has responded negatively to a BIND command.

chanStatLUType.name: chanStatLUType
chanStatLUType.description: LU Type. The Session type taken from the BIND command. It may be one of the following: Session Type Description 0 User defined applications. 1 Printer. 2 Full Screen 3270 applications. 3 Older type printers.

chanStatBreaksReceived.name: chanStatBreaksReceived
chanStatBreaksReceived.description: Breaks Rx The number of Break characters received from the terminal.

chanStatFramingErrors.name: chanStatFramingErrors
chanStatFramingErrors.description: Framing Errors. The number of characters received with no stop bit appended. The MegaPAC substitutes a '#' character in place of each framing error.

chanStatInputOverruns.name: chanStatInputOverruns
chanStatInputOverruns.description: Input Overruns. The number of times that data has been discarded due to a lack of receive buffers.

chanStatParityErrors.name: chanStatParityErrors
chanStatParityErrors.description: TParity Errors. he number of parity errors received on this channel.

chanStatTerminalType.name: chanStatTerminalType
chanStatTerminalType.description: Terminal Type. The type of emulation to be applied to the TERM controller, it may be one or more of the following: Type comment ASYN ASCII data support SYNC Bi-sync data support MINI Minitel terminal support HP H.P ENQ / ACK async protocol support X28 X28 command syntax (English) X28F X28 command syntax (French) ANSI Async ASCII Terminal support VPAD Viewdata PAD Emulation support MTRM MegaTerm PC Emulation support BUF Used for Buffer PVC call set-ups TPAD ACAB30 transaction card terminal support VT22 Async VT220Terminal support

chanStatCircuitType.name: chanStatCircuitType
chanStatCircuitType.description: Circuit Type. The type of circuit used on this channel, it may be one or more of the following:

chanStatOptions.name: chanStatOptions
chanStatOptions.description: The option(s) which have been envoked on this channel, one or more of:

chanStatBuffers.name: chanStatBuffers
chanStatBuffers.description: Buffers. The number of data buffers to be used as a threshold value before flow control to the terminal is invoked.

chanStatDiscMode.name: chanStatDiscMode
chanStatDiscMode.description: Disc mode. Specifies the call disconnect character that may be applied having established a route via the presentation service.

chanStatMenuNumber.name: chanStatMenuNumber
chanStatMenuNumber.description: Menu Number. Specifies which menu will be displayed to the user by the presentation service.

chanStatHelpNumber.name: chanStatHelpNumber
chanStatHelpNumber.description: Help Number. Specifies which help menu will be displayed to the user by the presentation service.

chanStatNewsNumber.name: chanStatNewsNumber
chanStatNewsNumber.description: News Number. The Menu number that will be displayed if an outgoing resource is unavailable.

chanStatPadRecall.name: chanStatPadRecall
chanStatPadRecall.description: Pad Recall. This parameter allows the user to escape from the data transfer state to the PAD command state. The permitted values are: 0 No PAD recall 1 Escape character is ^P 2 - 126 The decimal value specified is the escape character

chanStatEcho.name: chanStatEcho
chanStatEcho.description: Echo. Determines whether 'echo' is enabled or disabled. If set to controlled, the echo facility is controlled by the operator.

chanStatDataForwarding.name: chanStatDataForwarding
chanStatDataForwarding.description: Data Forwarding. This parameter controls which character or characters cause the accumulated data to be forwarded. The possible values may be added together to forward on one of a number of conditions. The allowable values are: 0 Forward only on buffer full. 128 Forward on graphics characters. 64 Forward on all characters in columns 0 and 1 of the International Alphabet No. 5. 1 Forward on A-Z, a-z and 0-9. 2 Forward on Carriage Return. 4 Forward on ESC, BEL, ENQ, ACK. 8 Forward on DEL, CAN, DC2. 16 Forward on EXT, EOT. 32 Forward on HT, LF, VT, FF.

chanStatDelay.name: chanStatDelay
chanStatDelay.description: Delay. Specifies the idle time in tenths of a second, allowable between successive characters before the accumulated data is forwarded. A value of 0 disables the timeout facility.

chanStatDRI.name: chanStatDRI
chanStatDRI.description: DRI. Flow control of terminal by the MegaPAC. Valid settings are: enabled MegaPAC flow controls terminal using XON/XOFF. cts MegaPAC flow controls terminal using CTS. init+enable MegaPAC sends XON automatically on initialisation. disable No flow control.

chanStatPadSignals.name: chanStatPadSignals
chanStatPadSignals.description: Pad Signals. Enable X.28 prompts and/or messages to be displayed on the users terminal.

chanStatBreak.name: chanStatBreak
chanStatBreak.description: Break. The Action the MegaPAC will take on receipt of a Break Signal. The valid values are: 0 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal no action is taken. 1 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an INTERRUPT packet. 2 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an RESET packet. 5 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an INTERRUPT packet and an indication of Break PAD message. 8 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will escape from data transfer state. 21 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an INTERRUPT packet and an indication of Break PAD message, while setting (X3) parameter (8) to the value 1 (discard any data received from the network).

chanStatPadding.name: chanStatPadding
chanStatPadding.description: Padding. The number of NULL characters inserted after a carriage return.

chanStatFold.name: chanStatFold
chanStatFold.description: Fold The number of characters output before line folding occurs. Setting to 0 disables line folding.

chanStatLFI.name: chanStatLFI
chanStatLFI.description: LFI. This parameter controls linefeed insertion after a carriage return. The valid seetings are: 0 Line feed insertion disabled. 1 A linefeed is inserted after a carriage return, in the data forwarded to the terminal. 4 A linefeed is sent to the terminal after echo of a carriage return to the terminal. 5 As defined by values 1 + 4. 6 Linefeed inserted after carriage return from terminal and each carriage return echoed to the terminal. 7 As defined by values 1 + 6.

chanStatLFPad.name: chanStatLFPad
chanStatLFPad.description: LFPad. The number of NULL padding characters sent to a device following a linefeed character.

chanStatEdit.name: chanStatEdit
chanStatEdit.description: Edit. Controls editing of text in data transfer state.

chanStatCharDel.name: chanStatCharDel
chanStatCharDel.description: Char Del. The keystroke used for deleting a character.

chanStatBufferDel.name: chanStatBufferDel
chanStatBufferDel.description: Buffer Del. The keystroke used for deleting the buffer.

chanStatDisp.name: chanStatDisp
chanStatDisp.description: Disp The keystroke used to redisplay the data in the buffer.

chanStatEditServiceSignals.name: chanStatEditServiceSignals
chanStatEditServiceSignals.description: Edit Service Signals. This parameter enables the user to edit the PAD service signals (echoing). The valid settings are: 0 No editing PAD service signals are echoed. 1 A '\' will be echoed for each character deleted. 2 A 'BS' character will be echoed for each character deleted. 8 and 32-126 Specifies the decimal value of the ASCII character to be echoed for each character deleted.

chanStatEchoMask.name: chanStatEchoMask
chanStatEchoMask.description: Echo Mask. This parameter controls the characters which should not be echoed. The valid settings are: 0 All characters should be echoed to the terminal. 1 do not echo carriage return. 2 do not echo linefeed. 4 do not echo VT, HT and FF characters. 8 do not echo BEL and BS character. 16 do not echo ESC and ENQ. 32 do not echo ACK, NAK, STX, SOH, EOT, ETB or ETX. 64 do not echo editing characters as defined by parameters 16, 17 and 18. 128 do not echo other control characters and DEL.

chanStatParityTreatment.name: chanStatParityTreatment
chanStatParityTreatment.description: Parity Treatment. Determines the parity generation and checking performed valid settings are: 0 No parity generation or checking. 1 Check parity. 2 Generate parity. 3 Check and generate parity.

chanStatPageWait.name: chanStatPageWait
chanStatPageWait.description: PageWait. Specifies the number of lines to be transmitted, after which the MegaPAC will wait until instructed by the user to continue sending data (by entering <CTRL >Q). A value of 0 disables the page wait facility.

chanStatForce.name: chanStatForce
chanStatForce.description: Forward Char. The ASCII character which will force data forwarding, 0 disables forced data forwarding.

chanStatBreakChar.name: chanStatBreakChar
chanStatBreakChar.description: Break Char. The ASCII character in decimal which is used to simulate a BREAK signal.

chanStatNetworkParity.name: chanStatNetworkParity
chanStatNetworkParity.description: Network Parity. With the Terminal type set to ASYN+X28, the parity can be forced onto the network side by selecting the approriate value.

chanStatEscapeDelay.name: chanStatEscapeDelay
chanStatEscapeDelay.description: Escape Delay. Specifies the time in tenths of a second, that after receiving an ESC character, all characters are buffered before being forwarded. During this time the ECHO facility is turned off, and is only restored when the delay timer has expired.

chanStatDestTsap.name: chanStatDestTsap
chanStatDestTsap.description: Destination TSAP The destination Transport Service Access Point.

chanStatTransportLevelState.name: chanStatTransportLevelState
chanStatTransportLevelState.description: Transport Level State. Transport Class 4 session statistics

chanStatLinkState.name: chanStatLinkState
chanStatLinkState.description: Link State. The current state of the Link Control Protocol

chanStatProtocolState.name: chanStatProtocolState
chanStatProtocolState.description: Protocol State. The current state of the Protocol Control Protocol

chanStatProtocol.name: chanStatProtocol
chanStatProtocol.description: Protocol Displays the protocol configured for the channel

chanStatIdentity.name: chanStatIdentity
chanStatIdentity.description: Identity. The current value of the IDENTITY field being put into the Link Control Protocol or Protocol Control Protocol commands.

chanStatDlciRxDe.name: chanStatDlciRxDe
chanStatDlciRxDe.description: DLCI RX Count. The total number of Frames with the DE bit set received on this channel since it entered Data State.

chanStatDlciTxDe.name: chanStatDlciTxDe
chanStatDlciTxDe.description: DLCI TX Count. The total number of Frames with the DE bit set transmitted on this channel since it entered Data State.

chanStatDlciRxFecn.name: chanStatDlciRxFecn
chanStatDlciRxFecn.description: DLCI RX Fecn Count. The total number of Fecns (Forward Explicit Congestion Notification) received on this channel since active.

chanStatDlciTxFecn.name: chanStatDlciTxFecn
chanStatDlciTxFecn.description: DLCI TX Fecn Count. The total number of Fecns (Forward Explicit Congestion Notification) transmitted on this channel since active.

chanStatDlciRxBecn.name: chanStatDlciRxBecn
chanStatDlciRxBecn.description: DLCI RX Becn Count. The total number of Becns (Backwards Explicit Congestion Notification) received on this channel since active.

chanStatDlciTxBecn.name: chanStatDlciTxBecn
chanStatDlciTxBecn.description: DLCI TX Becn Count. The total number of Becns (Backwards Explicit Congestion Notification) transmitted on this channel since active.

chanStatConnectedToControllerIndex.name: chanStatConnectedToControllerIndex
chanStatConnectedToControllerIndex.reference: NMS CONS V25B SRU IP SDLC MULT CLUS LAN TERM ILAN XLAN QLLC HDLC X25 MAP SNMP DLC TLAN NFRM VFRM XFRM PPP ESIS IPX TIPX TIP ROUT
chanStatConnectedToControllerIndex.description: Connected to Index. The INDEX of the CONTROLLER that this channel is connected to.

chanParamTable.name: chanParamTable
chanParamTable.description: A table of channels associated with this Level 2 controller.

chanParamIndex.name: chanParamIndex
chanParamIndex.description: Index. The position of this channel in the controller channel Table.

chanParamName.name: chanParamName
chanParamName.description: Name. A user defined name for routing calls to this channel.

chanParamDRCMask.name: chanParamDRCMask
chanParamDRCMask.description: DRC Mask. A four character string used to force expicit routing to the named resource.

chanParamTerminalType.name: chanParamTerminalType
chanParamTerminalType.reference: CLUS CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN DLC ILAN SDLC QLLC
chanParamTerminalType.description: Terminal Type. If the channel is to perform terminal emulation, then the setting defined will be specific to the users terminal envoking emulation.

chanParamCircuitType.name: chanParamCircuitType
chanParamCircuitType.reference: CONS DLC ESIS HDLC ILAN IP TIP IPX TIPX LAN TLAN MAP MULT NFRM VFRM NMS PPP QLLC SDLC ROUT SRU TERM V25B X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamCircuitType.description: Circuit Type. The type of circuit used on this channel

chanParamOptions.name: chanParamOptions
chanParamOptions.reference: CLUS CONS IP TIP PPP ROUT TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamOptions.description: Options. A range of channel options, these options may be specified individually or added together.

chanParamBuffers.name: chanParamBuffers
chanParamBuffers.description: Buffers. The number of system buffers allocated to this channel for incoming calls.

chanParamDiscMode.name: chanParamDiscMode
chanParamDiscMode.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamDiscMode.description: DISC Mode. The number of the character in decimal which forces disconnection of the call.

chanParamMenuNumber.name: chanParamMenuNumber
chanParamMenuNumber.reference: CLUS CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamMenuNumber.description: Menu Number. Specifies which menu will be displayed to the user by the presentation service

chanParamHelpNumber.name: chanParamHelpNumber
chanParamHelpNumber.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamHelpNumber.description: Help Number. Specifies which help screen will be displayed to the user by the presentation service.

chanParamNewsNumber.name: chanParamNewsNumber
chanParamNewsNumber.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamNewsNumber.description: News Number. The number of the menu which will be displayed if an outgoing channel is unavailable.

chanParamCallPriority.name: chanParamCallPriority
chanParamCallPriority.reference: CONS DLC ESIS HDLC ILAN IP TIP IPX TIPX LAN TLAN MAP MULT NFRM VFRM NMS QLLC SDLC ROUT SRU TERM V25B X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamCallPriority.description: Call Priority. Call and Resource priorities are used primarily for providing alternate routing. For a call to succeed the Call Priority on the incoming channel must be greater than or equal to the Resource Priority on the outgoing channel.

chanParamResourcePriority.name: chanParamResourcePriority
chanParamResourcePriority.reference: CONS DLC ESIS HDLC ILAN IP TIP IPX TIPX LAN TLAN MAP MULT NFRM VFRM NMS QLLC SDLC ROUT SRU TERM V25B X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamResourcePriority.description: Resource Priority. Call and Resource priorities are used primarily for providing alternate routing. For a call to succeed the Call Priority on the incoming channel must be greater than or equal to the Resource Priority on the outgoing channel.

chanParamPadEnable.name: chanParamPadEnable
chanParamPadEnable.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamPadEnable.description: Pad Enable. The effect of the PAD Enable parameters are as follows: enable PAD services enabled. The logical channel will respond to X.29 packets. enable-rev REVerse PAD enabled. When a call is established to this channel, the MegaPAC will generate an X.29 qualified data packet back to the caller, containing the X.3 operating values specified in the channel's configuration. enable-prof The X.3 profile settings for the channel will be derived by referencing the logical channel's NAME/ parameter to the NAME/ field in the PROF file. The X.3 settings as contained in the PROF file record are then loaded onto the channel.

chanParamPadRecall.name: chanParamPadRecall
chanParamPadRecall.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamPadRecall.description: Pad Recall (1). This parameter allows the user to escape from the data transfer state to the PAD command state. The permitted values are: 0 No PAD recall 1 Escape character is ^P 2 - 126 The decimal value specified is the escape character

chanParamEcho.name: chanParamEcho
chanParamEcho.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamEcho.description: Echo. Determines whether 'echo' is enabled or disabled. If set to controlled, the echo facility is controlled by the operator.

chanParamDataForwarding.name: chanParamDataForwarding
chanParamDataForwarding.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamDataForwarding.description: Data Forwarding. This parameter controls which character or characters cause the accumulated data to be forwarded. The possible values may be added together to forward on one of a number of conditions. The allowable values are: 0 Forward only on buffer full. 128 Forward on graphics characters. 64 Forward on all characters in columns 0 and 1 of the International Alphabet No. 5. 1 Forward on A-Z, a-z and 0-9. 2 Forward on Carriage Return. 4 Forward on ESC, BEL, ENQ, ACK. 8 Forward on DEL, CAN, DC2. 16 Forward on EXT, EOT. 32 Forward on HT, LF, VT, FF.

chanParamDelay.name: chanParamDelay
chanParamDelay.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamDelay.description: Delay. Specifies the idle time in tenths of a second, allowable between successive characters before the accumulated data is forwarded. A value of 0 disables the timeout facility.

chanParamDRI.name: chanParamDRI
chanParamDRI.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamDRI.description: DRI. Flow control of terminal by the MegaPAC. Valid settings are: enabled MegaPAC flow controls terminal using XON/XOFF. cts MegaPAC flow controls terminal using CTS. init+enable MegaPAC sends XON automatically on initialisation. disable No flow control.

chanParamPadSignals.name: chanParamPadSignals
chanParamPadSignals.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamPadSignals.description: Pad Signals. Enable X.28 prompts and/or messages to be displayed on the users terminal.

chanParamBreak.name: chanParamBreak
chanParamBreak.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamBreak.description: Break. The Action the MegaPAC will take on receipt of a Break Signal. The valid values are: 0 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal no action is taken. 1 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an INTERRUPT packet. 2 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an RESET packet. 5 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an INTERRUPT packet and an indication of Break PAD message. 8 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will escape from data transfer state. 21 When the MegaPAC receives a Break Signal from the terminal it will transmit an INTERRUPT packet and an indication of Break PAD message, while setting (X3) parameter (8) to the value 1 (discard any data received from the network).

chanParamPadding.name: chanParamPadding
chanParamPadding.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamPadding.description: Padding. The number of NULL characters inserted after a carriage return.

chanParamFold.name: chanParamFold
chanParamFold.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamFold.description: Fold. The number of characters output before line folding occurs. Setting to 0 disables line folding.

chanParamDRO.name: chanParamDRO
chanParamDRO.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN

chanParamLFI.name: chanParamLFI
chanParamLFI.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamLFI.description: LFI. This parameter controls linefeed insertion after a carriage return. The valid settings are: 0 Line feed insertion disabled. 1 A linefeed is inserted after a carriage return, in the data forwarded to the terminal. 4 A linefeed is sent to the terminal after echo of a carriage return to the terminal. 5 As defined by values 1 + 4. 6 Linefeed inserted after carriage return from terminal and each carriage return echoed to the terminal. 7 As defined by values 1 + 6.

chanParamLFPad.name: chanParamLFPad
chanParamLFPad.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamLFPad.description: LFPad. The number of NULL padding characters sent to a device following a linefeed character.

chanParamEdit.name: chanParamEdit
chanParamEdit.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamEdit.description: Edit. Controls editing of text in data transfer state.

chanParamCharDel.name: chanParamCharDel
chanParamCharDel.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamCharDel.description: Char Delete. The keystroke used for deleting a character.

chanParamBufferDel.name: chanParamBufferDel
chanParamBufferDel.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamBufferDel.description: Buffer Delete. The keystroke used for deleting the buffer.

chanParamDisp.name: chanParamDisp
chanParamDisp.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamDisp.description: Disp. The keystroke used to redisplay the data in the buffer.

chanParamEditServiceSignals.name: chanParamEditServiceSignals
chanParamEditServiceSignals.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamEditServiceSignals.description: Edit Service Signals. This parameter enables the user to edit the PAD service signals (echoing). The valid settings are: 0 No editing PAD service signals are echoed. 1 A '\' will be echoed for each character deleted. 2 A 'BS' character will be echoed for each character deleted. 8 and 32-126 Specifies the decimal value of the ASCII character to be echoed for each character deleted.

chanParamEchoMask.name: chanParamEchoMask
chanParamEchoMask.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamEchoMask.description: Echo Mask. This parameter controls the characters which should not be echoed. The valid settings are: 0 All characters should be echoed to the terminal. 1 do not echo carriage return. 2 do not echo linefeed. 4 do not echo VT, HT and FF characters. 8 do not echo BEL and BS character. 16 do not echo ESC and ENQ. 32 do not echo ACK, NAK, STX, SOH, EOT, ETB or ETX. 64 do not echo editing characters as defined by parameters 16, 17 and 18. 128 do not echo other control characters and DEL.

chanParamParityTreatment.name: chanParamParityTreatment
chanParamParityTreatment.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamParityTreatment.description: Parity Treatment. Determines the parity generation and checking performed valid settings are: 0 No parity generation or checking. 1 Check parity. 2 Generate parity. 3 Check and generate parity.

chanParamPageWait.name: chanParamPageWait
chanParamPageWait.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamPageWait.description: Page Wait. Specifies the number of lines to be transmitted, after which the MegaPAC will wait until instructed by the user to continue sending data (by entering <CTRL >Q). A value of 0 disables the page wait facility.

chanParamForce.name: chanParamForce
chanParamForce.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamForce.description: Force. The ASCII character which will force data forwarding, 0 disables forced data forwarding.

chanParamBreakChar.name: chanParamBreakChar
chanParamBreakChar.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamBreakChar.description: Break Character. The ASCII character in decimal which is used to simulate a BREAK signal.

chanParamNetworkParity.name: chanParamNetworkParity
chanParamNetworkParity.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamNetworkParity.description: Network Parity. With the Terminal type set to ASYN+X28, the parity can be forced onto the network side by selecting the approriate value.

chanParamEscapeDelay.name: chanParamEscapeDelay
chanParamEscapeDelay.reference: CONS IP TIP TERM X25 XFRM XLAN
chanParamEscapeDelay.description: Escape Delay. Specifies the time in tenths of a second, that after receiving an ESC character, all characters are buffered before being forwarded. During this time the ECHO facility is turned off, and is only restored when the delay timer has expired.

chanParamStationAddress.name: chanParamStationAddress
chanParamStationAddress.description: Station Address. Physical Unit Address of the Cluster Controller.

chanParamMode.name: chanParamMode
chanParamMode.description: Mode. This parameter provides a number of additional connection facilities for channels on virtual controllers.

chanParamPortMatch.name: chanParamPortMatch
chanParamPortMatch.description: Port Match. This parameter optionally allows the Source and Destination ports to be used in conjunction with the IP address for routing.

chanParamReverseTelnetPort.name: chanParamReverseTelnetPort
chanParamReverseTelnetPort.description: Reverse Telnet Port. The port number which will respond to TELNET open requests. The default value for TELNET ports is '23'.

chanParamInhibitLearning.name: chanParamInhibitLearning
chanParamInhibitLearning.description: Inhibit Learning. This parameter determines whether the 'bridge' will work in Directed or Learning mode. If InhibitLearning is set to 'Yes' then the bridge will only forward frames whose addresses are fixed in the forwarding table.

chanParamRetainSession.name: chanParamRetainSession
chanParamRetainSession.description: Retain Session. This parameter determines if and how a session will be cleared down when the call is cleared. The parameter is only applicable to channels (2) to (n). If set to NOTIFY or NO the session will be cleared when the call disconnects , NOTIFY will cause a NOTIFY RU to be sent indicating the disconnection. If this parameter is set to YES then the session will be retained on channel disconnection, this is used to provide a hot key switching facility.

chanParamPrinterType.name: chanParamPrinterType
chanParamPrinterType.description: Printer Type. If set to IBM the logical channel will act as an appication system printer, otherwise it operates in screen emulation mode. Only applicable to channels (2) to (n).

chanParamScreenPrinter.name: chanParamScreenPrinter
chanParamScreenPrinter.description: Screen Printer. If set to YES, screen printer requests are to be processed and sent to this LU address (in this mode, the terminal attaching to this channel MUST have a printer attached). If set to NO, screen printing is supported via the LOCAL PRINTER or the DEFAULT LOCAL PRINTER parameters.

chanParamLocalPrinter.name: chanParamLocalPrinter
chanParamLocalPrinter.description: Local Printer. This parameter specifies the channel to which screen printing should be directed. It takes precedence over the value defined by the DEFAULT LOCAL PRINTER at controller level. This parameter may only be applied to channels (2) to (n).

chanParamInterlockBind.name: chanParamInterlockBind
chanParamInterlockBind.description: Interlock Bind. This parameter is only applicable to channels (2) to (n). When set to YES, an UNBIND request will be sent to the host upon disconnecting. Note: when used in cojunction with a 4 character DRC mask, this setting will invoke a call set-up when a BIND is received. This setting is often used when sending a file transfer accross a Public Network.

chanParamRedirectPrintTo.name: chanParamRedirectPrintTo
chanParamRedirectPrintTo.description: Redirect Printer To. This parameter is only applicable to channels (2) to (n). If set to (0), then no redirection takes place. Otherwise, LU type 1 session data is output to the nominated logical channel, each block being preceeded by the escape sequence to switch to the auxiliary port, and followed by the sequence to switch it back to the screen again. This is useful in several environments, Foe example, using two LU channels it enables a terminal user to interact with the Host, and receive Host system prints at the same terminal (supporting a printer).

chanParamLUBase.name: chanParamLUBase
chanParamLUBase.description: First LU defined by up-stream host.

chanParamLUTotal.name: chanParamLUTotal
chanParamLUTotal.description: Total number of LUs to be allocated to down- stream PU's.

chanParamDlciAdjacentBase.name: chanParamDlciAdjacentBase
chanParamDlciAdjacentBase.description: The DLCI number on the cross connected port in the MegaPAC used when groups of channels are being switched across the MegaPAC. Used in conjunction with the DRC mask.

chanParamDlciPriority.name: chanParamDlciPriority
chanParamDlciPriority.description: A value from 0 to 32 indicating the relative priority of this DLCI to the other data streams on this trunk, i.e. other DLCIs. The higher the value the higher the priority.

chanParamDlciATM.name: chanParamDlciATM
chanParamDlciATM.description: Determines whether fragmentation should be implemented on frames on this link.

chanParamDlciCir.name: chanParamDlciCir
chanParamDlciCir.description: The committed information rate for this DLCI - the units are in 80bits/sec

chanParamDlciBc.name: chanParamDlciBc
chanParamDlciBc.description: Bc(Burst Commit) - the committed burst that the MegaPAC will allow to be transmitted on this DLCI; the units are 80bits.

chanParamDlciBe.name: chanParamDlciBe
chanParamDlciBe.description: Be(Burst Excess) is the excess above the Bc that will be transmitted to the line by the MegaPAC in any given Tc. The units are 80bits.

chanParamDlciDe.name: chanParamDlciDe
chanParamDlciDe.description: DE(Discard Eligibility) when set will indicate that in a congested situation this frame should be discarded first.

chanParamDlciDsap.name: chanParamDlciDsap
chanParamDlciDsap.description: Used in RFC 1490 SNA connections - each SAP identifies a specific PU, hence by using different SAPs, multiple PUs can be multiplexed on the same Frame Relay PVC

chanParamDlciSsap.name: chanParamDlciSsap
chanParamDlciSsap.description: Used in RFC 1490 SNA connections - each SAP identifies a specific PU, hence by using different SAPs, multiple PUs can be multiplexed on the same Frame Relay PVC

chanParamDlciPutype.name: chanParamDlciPutype
chanParamDlciPutype.description: Used in RFC 1490 SNA connections - specifies type 2.0 or 2.1

x25FileSize.name: x25FileSize
x25FileSize.description: X25 file size. The number of entries configured into the X25 file.

x25Table.name: x25Table
x25Table.description: A table of X.25 routing entries

x25Index.name: x25Index
x25Index.description: Index. The index to an individual X.25 entry

x25Name.name: x25Name
x25Name.description: Name. A 4 character name which is used to match on the 'NAME' parameter of the channel on which a call will be routed over the X.25 network.

x25AddressGroup.name: x25AddressGroup
x25AddressGroup.description: Address Group. An integer used to partition the X.25 routing tables. Any match on a channel name will only take effect if the channel 'AddressGroup' parameter is set to the same value.

x25Address.name: x25Address
x25Address.description: Address. The numeric address which is used to match on the incoming X.25 address in a call request packet.

x25UserData.name: x25UserData
x25UserData.description: User Data A text field in which Call User Data or Facilities may be placed. The user data will be inserted into call request packets generated by the MegaPAC.

nameFileSize.name: nameFileSize
nameFileSize.description: Name File Size. The number of entries configured into the NAME file.

nameIndex.name: nameIndex
nameIndex.description: Index. The index into the name table.

nameName.name: nameName
nameName.description: Name. A string of up to 8 characters in length which is typed in by the network user in order to establish a connection to a specific resource.

nameDRCMask.name: nameDRCMask
nameDRCMask.description: DRC Mask. The four character resource (channel) name to which the call will be directed.

nameCallPriority.name: nameCallPriority
nameCallPriority.description: Call Priority. The internal call priority which will be assigned to the call.

nameBilling.name: nameBilling
nameBilling.description: Billing If enabled, statistics relating to the call will be sent to the billing file.

nameOptions.name: nameOptions
nameOptions.description: Options Enables the appropriate terminal emulation options.

passFileSize.name: passFileSize
passFileSize.description: Pass File Size. The number of entries configured into the PASSWORD file.

macFileSize.name: macFileSize
macFileSize.description: Mac File Size. The number of entries configured into the MAC file.

macIndex.name: macIndex
macIndex.description: Index. An index to an individual entry in the MAC table.

macName.name: macName
macName.description: Name. The level 2 controller name to which this entry applies.

macFunction.name: macFunction
macFunction.description: Function. The function field determines what action should be taken if their is a match on this entry.

macOptions.name: macOptions
macOptions.description: Options. Specific actions that may be envoked in conjunction with the function field.

macSelector.name: macSelector
macSelector.description: Selector. This field can contain a string of between 0 and 32 Hexadecimal characters, that must be matched by the Function DAD, CAD, CUD or FAC.

macGenerator.name: macGenerator
macGenerator.description: Generator. This field can contain a string of between 0 and 32 Hexadecimal characters, and can have different purposes depending on the Function or Options fields.

ilanFileSize.name: ilanFileSize
ilanFileSize.description: Ilan File Size. The number of entries configured into the ILAN file.

ilanIndex.name: ilanIndex
ilanIndex.description: Index. An index to an individual entry in the ILAN table.

ilanName.name: ilanName
ilanName.description: Name. The Resource which this entry applies to.

ilanOptions.name: ilanOptions
ilanOptions.description: Options ISO Allows transport calls to be set up on the outgoing channel. EXPE Allows expedited data to be sent.

ilanEthernetAddress.name: ilanEthernetAddress
ilanEthernetAddress.description: Ethernet Address. The destination MAC address of the named host.

ilanTSAP.name: ilanTSAP
ilanTSAP.description: TSAP. The Transport Service Access Point required on the destination Host.

elogFileSize.name: elogFileSize
elogFileSize.description: Elog File Size. The size of the error log file.

elogTable.name: elogTable
elogTable.description: A table of Error Log entries.

elogIndex.name: elogIndex
elogIndex.description: Index. The index to an Error Log entry.

elogRecord.name: elogRecord
elogRecord.description: Record. The Error Log entry in ascii format.

errorLogReport.name: errorLogReport
errorLogReport.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC. The Error Log entry in ascii format

sysRestart.name: sysRestart
sysRestart.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC System restart.

configChange.name: configChange
configChange.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Configuration Change.

vcpConnect.name: vcpConnect
vcpConnect.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC VCP Connect.

vcpDisconnect.name: vcpDisconnect
vcpDisconnect.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC VCP Disconnect.

billThreshReached.name: billThreshReached
billThreshReached.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC- threshold reached for No. of BILLING records outstanding.

linkNoResponse.name: linkNoResponse
linkNoResponse.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Not Responding.

linkCarrierLoss.name: linkCarrierLoss
linkCarrierLoss.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Carrier Loss.

linkAddressErr.name: linkAddressErr
linkAddressErr.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Address Error.

frameLessThan2.name: frameLessThan2
frameLessThan2.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Frame < 2 BYTES.

ifieldTooLarge.name: ifieldTooLarge
ifieldTooLarge.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link I-Field too Large.

linkRestart.name: linkRestart
linkRestart.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link restart.

linkBlocked.name: linkBlocked
linkBlocked.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC LINK BLOCKED (Flow controlled).

linkDisconnect.name: linkDisconnect
linkDisconnect.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Disconnected.

linkFrmrRecvd.name: linkFrmrRecvd
linkFrmrRecvd.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link FRMR received.

linkDmResponse.name: linkDmResponse
linkDmResponse.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link DM response.

linkBadNr.name: linkBadNr
linkBadNr.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Bad N(r).

linkDown.name: linkDown
linkDown.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Down.

linkFrmrSent.name: linkFrmrSent
linkFrmrSent.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link FRMR sent.

crcThreshExceeded.name: crcThreshExceeded
crcThreshExceeded.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC CRC Threshold Exceeded.

linkManRestart.name: linkManRestart
linkManRestart.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Link Manual restart.

testIndicationResponse.name: testIndicationResponse
testIndicationResponse.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC 'TEST' command Indication/Response.

interfaceFailure.name: interfaceFailure
interfaceFailure.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Inteface (e.g. chip) failure.

xidComRecvd.name: xidComRecvd
xidComRecvd.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC XID command received.

bufferOverrun.name: bufferOverrun
bufferOverrun.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Buffer Overrun Error.

connectTimeWarn.name: connectTimeWarn
connectTimeWarn.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC Connect Time Warning.

isdnNameAssigned.name: isdnNameAssigned
isdnNameAssigned.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC ISDN/V25 bis Name Assigned.

isdnNameDeAassigned.name: isdnNameDeAassigned
isdnNameDeAassigned.description: Enterprise Specific trap for MegaPAC ISDN/V25 bis Name De-Assigned.
